DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Breast Reconstruction Musculus Latissimus Dorsi Tissue Flap Performed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date of a surgical procedure that involves removing tissue from the latissimus dorsi muscle, tunneling it underneath the skin to its new location and forming a new breast mound.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Breast Reconstruction Musculus Latissimus Dorsi Tissue Flap Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to a surgical procedure that involves removing tissue from the latissimus dorsi muscle, tunneling it underneath the skin to its new location and forming a new breast mound.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredName: Breast Reconstruction Musculus Latissimus Dorsi Tissue Flap Reconstruction Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: Surgery to rebuild a breast's shape after a mastectomy.:A triangular muscle in the back, connected to the vertebral column, arm, and shoulder. Its action involves adduction, medial rotation, and extension of the arm.:A type of breast reconstruction in which a flap of tissue is surgically moved from another area of the body to the chest, and formed into a new breast mound.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: A triangular muscle in the back, connected to the vertebral column, arm, and shoulder. Its action involves adduction, medial rotation, and extension of the arm.
Breast reconstruction that uses tissues taken from other parts of the individual's body.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to Alliance for by script Fri Oct 25 15:25:44 EDT 2013

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
